JAPANESE: 燃料は、{{FURNITURE.BLOOMERY_FURNACE}} と {{FURNITURE.FORGE}} の両方によって金属の製造に必要とされる。

ENGLISH: A {{PROFESSION.CHEF}} works here to turn {{RESOURCE.FLOUR.SACK.PLURAL}} into {{INGREDIENT.DOUGH}}.
JAPANESE: {{PROFESSION.CHEF}} は {{RESOURCE.FLOUR.SACK.PLURAL}} を {{INGREDIENT.DOUGH}} に変えるためにここで働いています。

JAPANESE: {{PROFESSION.CHEF}} は、準備された {{INGREDIENT.DOUGH}} を使ってここのパンを焼きます。

ENGLISH: A beer barrel is on the way

ENGLISH: A {{PROFESSION.BLACKSMITH}} uses this hand-operated furnace to turn {{RESOURCE.ORE.CRUSHED.PLURAL}} and {{FUEL.SACK}} into {{MATERIAL_TYPE.METAL.ADJECTIVE}} {{RESOURCE.METAL.INGOT.PLURAL}}.
JAPANESE: {{プロフェッショナル.ブラックスミス}} はこの手作業で操作する炉を使用して {{リソース.鉱石.くじ.多型}} と {{燃料.サック} を {材質.金属.調整可能} {リソース.金属.金属.多型} に変わります。

ENGLISH: This is used to produce the final wort (unfermented beer) using {{VEGETABLE.HOPS}} and wort from the {{FURNITURE.MASH_TUN}}.
Most wooden items and tools are produced here, such as {{PRODUCT.BUCKET.PLURAL}} and {{PRODUCT.BARREL.PLURAL}}.
JAPANESE: {{PRODUCT.BUCKET.PLURAL}} や {{PRODUCT.BARREL.PLURAL} など、ほとんどの木製アイテムや道具がここで生産されています。

NOTES: A large metal pot for cooking (common with Halloween)

ENGLISH: A cauldron is used to serve a large quantity of soup to hungry settlers. The soup is produced in a {{ROOMS.KITCHEN}} before being moved to a {{ROOMS.FEASTING_HALL}} for serving.
JAPANESE: 大釜は、空腹の入植者に大量のスープを提供するために使用されます。 スープは、{{ルームズ.キッチン}} で生産され、{{ルームズ.フィアスティングホール}} に移されます。

ENGLISH: This is a pile of {{RESOURCE.LOGS.PLURAL}} covered with {{MATERIAL_TYPE.EARTH}} and slowly burned to produce {{ORE.CHARCOAL.NOUN}}, which can then be used as {{FUEL.SACK}}.
JAPANESE: これは {{材質タイプ.地面}} で覆われた {{リソース.LOGS.PLURAL}} の山で、{{天然石炭.NOUN} を生産するためにゆっくりと燃やされ、{{燃料.SACK} として使用することができます。

ENGLISH: A coke oven converts {{ORE.BITUMINOUS_COAL.NOUN}} into {{ORE.COKE.NOUN}} so that it can be used as {{FUEL.SACK}}.
JAPANESE: コークスオーブンは、{{{炭酸塩コークス}} を {{核酸コークス}} に変換し、{{FUEL.SACK} として使用できるようにします。

{{商品種別.名詞}} を待機しています
充填されるのを待っています

ENGLISH: Waiting to be injected with mushroom spawn
JAPANESE: キノコの産卵を注入するのを待っています

NOTES: A very large table for a feast

ENGLISH: With a {{FURNITURE.CHAIR}} in place, your settlers will enjoy their meals at this table.
JAPANESE: {{FURNITURE.CHAIR}} を配置すると、入植者はこのテーブルで食事を楽しむことができます。

ENGLISH: This is where {{LIQUID.HOPPED_WORT}} is fermented into {{LIQUID.BEER}}.

NOTES: This is a table with a hand-operated flour mill stone on top

ENGLISH: The gristmill grinds {{VEGETABLE.WHEAT}} into {{RESOURCE.FLOUR.SACK.NOUN}} so that it can be used by a {{PROFESSION.CHEF}}.
JAPANESE: このグリスミルは {{野菜.小麦}} を {{リソース.フローアー.サック.ノウン}} に粉砕し、{{PROFESSION.CHEF}} が使用できるようにします。

ENGLISH: This is where a {{PROFESSION.BLACKSMITH}} works with {{MATERIAL_TYPE.METAL.ADJECTIVE}} {{RESOURCE.METAL.INGOT.PLURAL}} and {{FUEL.SACK}} to craft items and weapons.
JAPANESE: これは、{{プロフェッショナル.ブラックスミス}} が {{材質タイプ.金属.調整式}} {{リソース.金属.インゴット.多型} および {燃料.サック} と連動し、アイテムや武器をクラフトします。

ENGLISH: A hastily-dug grave for deceased settlers that can only be placed in {{MATERIAL_TYPE.EARTH}}.
JAPANESE: 死亡した入植者のための急いで掘られた墓で、{{MATERIAL_TYPE.EARTH}} にのみ置くことができます。

NOTES: Simple piece of furniture in a kitchen used to hold ingredients on top of it
JAPANESE: キッチンワークトップ

ENGLISH: An area to store ingredients for a {{PROFESSION.CHEF}} to cook soup.
JAPANESE: スープを作るために {{PROFESSION.CHEF}} の食材を貯蔵するエリア。

ENGLISH: A lantern provides light – this does not currently have an in-game effect.
JAPANESE: ランタンは光を提供します。これは現在、ゲーム内の効果はありません。

ENGLISH: Here brewers steep barley and then dry it out using a kiln to produce malt.
This is used to produce wort (unfermented beer) from milled malt and water.
A log that has been injected with {{INGREDIENT.MUSHROOM.SPAWN.PLURAL}} to produce several harvests of delicious, juicy mushrooms.
JAPANESE: おいしいジューシーなキノコのいくつかの収穫を生産するために {{成分.キノコ.スポーン.PLURAL}} を注入されたログ。

NOTES: This is a trough of water used to immerse mushroom logs in for a period of time

ENGLISH: After innoculation, a {{FURNITURE.MUSHROOM_LOG}} is placed in this tank to “shock” the mushroom colony and encourage it to grow mushrooms.
JAPANESE: 接種後、このタンクに {{FURNITURE.MUSHROOM_LOG}} を置き、キノコのコロニーを「衝撃」させ、キノコ栽培を促します。

ENGLISH: Raw {{RESOURCE.ORE.UNREFINED.PLURAL}} is crushed to a more workable size so that it can be used in a {{FURNITURE.BLOOMERY_FURNACE}}.
JAPANESE: 生の {{リソース.ORE.REFINED.PLURAL}} は、{{FURNITURE.BLOOMERY_FURNACE} で使用できるように、より実行可能なサイズに粉砕されます。

NOTES: A pillar used to support a roof

ENGLISH: A pillar is required to stop large mined-out areas from collapsing. An area of 7x7 tiles that have been mined without any pillars or other supports in place will eventually collapse.
JAPANESE: 大きな掘り出し出しエリアが崩壊するのを止めるには、柱が必要です。 柱やその他の支柱なしで採掘された7x7タイルの面積は、最終的に崩壊するでしょう。

NOTES: A stone tomb

ENGLISH: This elaborate stone container is the final resting place of a deceased settler.
JAPANESE: この精巧な石容器は、故人の入植者の最後の休息地です。

NOTES: A table used to hold food for serving

ENGLISH: {{PRODUCT.BREAD.LOAF.PLURAL}} are placed here for serving after being baked in a {{FURNITURE.BAKING_OVEN}}.
JAPANESE: {{{製品.パン.ローフ.多数}} は、{{食品.パン.ローフ.多数}} で焼いた後に提供するためにここに置かれます。

ENGLISH: A bed is the best place for a comfortable night’s rest.
JAPANESE: ベッドは快適な夜の休息に最適な場所です。
ストーンメイソンワークベンチ
{{プロフェッショナル.ストーンメイソン}} は、{{マテリアル_タイプ.ストーン.調整可能}} のリソースで動作します。

ENGLISH: A water barrel is a place for your settlers to get a thirst-quenching drink, rather than having to find a natural water source like the river.
JAPANESE: 水筒は、川のような天然の水源を見つけるのではなく、あなたの入植者が喉の渇きを飲むための場所です。
木材カッティングベンチ

ENGLISH: A {{PROFESSION.WOODCUTTER}} works here to turn {{RESOURCE.LOGS.PLURAL}} into {{RESOURCE.PLANKS.PLURAL}}.
JAPANESE: {{プロフェッショナル.ウッドカッター}} は {{リソース.LOGS.PLURAL}} を {リソース.PLANKS.PLURAL} に変えるためにここで働きます。

ENGLISH: A violet-hued variety of quartz. Ancient humans believed it could magically protect them from becoming too drunk. For this reason it is not very popular in dwarven culture.
JAPANESE: 紫色の色の様々な石英。 古代の人間は、それが魔法のように酔ってからそれらを守ることができると信じていました。 このため、ドワーフ文化ではあまり人気がありません。

ENGLISH: An opal-like gemstone which has a red to green iridescence. It is known as the “hunting stone” and amulets made from it are meant to bring good luck to a hunt.
JAPANESE: 赤から緑の虹色のオパールのような宝石。 それは「狩猟石」として知られており、そこから作られたお守りは、狩りに幸運をもたらすためのものです。

ENGLISH: A cyan-coloured variety of beryl. Some humans believe it offers magical protection against the dangers of the seas. This is because an ancient mage used a combination of sky and ice magic to protect trading ships during the age of darkness.
JAPANESE: シアン色のベリル。 一部の人間は、それが海の危険に対する魔法の保護を提供すると信じています。 これは、古代の魔道師が闇の時代に貿易船を保護するために空と氷の魔法を組み合わせて使用したためです。

ENGLISH: Also known as red beryl, it is a very rare gemstone. It is often confused for a red-coloured emerald.
JAPANESE: 赤ベリルとも呼ばれ、非常に希少な宝石です。 赤色のエメラルドと混同されることが多い。

ENGLISH: An ore of mercury which is often used in jewellery due to its deep-red hue. It is also used to produce the dye known as vermillion.
JAPANESE: 水銀の鉱石で、ディープレッドの色合いの宝飾品によく使われます。 また、朱色と呼ばれる染料を製造するために使用されます。

ENGLISH: A yellowish variety of quartz. It is the gemstone most similar in colour to gold, so most dwarves think citrine is lucky.
JAPANESE: 黄色がかった様々な石英。 宝石は金と最も似ているので、ほとんどのドワーフはシトリンが幸運だと思っています。

ENGLISH: The hardest known material and one of the most important of the seven heavenly stones. Diamonds are the most condensed form of the neutral element known as “spirit” or “aether”.
JAPANESE: 最も難しい既知の材料と7つの天の石の中で最も重要なものの一つ。 ダイヤモンドは、「精神」または「エーテル」と呼ばれる中性元素の最も凝縮された形態です。

ENGLISH: A vibrant green variety of beryl. It is thought that engraving on an emerald brings great misfortune. Emeralds are closely related to elemental life and associated magic.
JAPANESE: 鮮やかな緑のベリル。 エメラルドの彫刻は大きな不幸をもたらすと考えられています。 エメラルドは、元素の生命と関連する魔法と密接に関連しています。

ENGLISH: Garnets cover a variety of minerals used as gemstones, all with a deep red colour. Some garnet gems are actually a condensed form of elemental fire.
JAPANESE: ガーネットは、宝石として使用される様々なミネラルをカバーし、すべて深い赤色です。 いくつかのガーネットの宝石は、実際には元素の火の凝縮形です。

ENGLISH: A mineral with a light-green colour often used for decoration. Also, elves have been known to use jade to produce medicine which can cure ailments of the gut.
JAPANESE: 多くの場合、装飾のために使用される明るい緑色の鉱物。 また、エルフはヒスイを使って腸の病気を治すことができる薬を作ることも知られています。

ENGLISH: An impure variety of silica which can occur in several colours, but most commonly red. Jasper is favoured as a decoration material by orcs due to its variety.
JAPANESE: シリカの不純な品種で、いくつかの色がありますが、最も一般的に赤色です。 ジャスパーは、その多様性のためにオークによって装飾材料として好まれている。

ENGLISH: A rock which shines with a typically light-blue iridescence. Rarer specimens can reflect a wide range of colours.
JAPANESE: 典型的には淡い青色の虹色に輝く岩。 まれな標本は、幅広い色を反映することができます。

ENGLISH: A rock with a brilliant deep blue hue which is used as a precious stone.
JAPANESE: 貴石として使用される華麗な深みのある青色の岩石。

ENGLISH: A mineral which can be polished into beads for use in jewellery. These beads can by dyed into many different colours.
JAPANESE: ジュエリーに使用するためにビーズに磨くことができる鉱物。 これらのビーズは、多くの異なる色に染色することができます。

ENGLISH: Thought to be formed by moonlight captured in rock, which makes this gemstone a favourite of the elves.
JAPANESE: 岩に捕らえられた月光によって形成されると思われます。この宝石はエルフのお気に入りです。

ENGLISH: A rose-coloured variety of beryl. It was named after being popularised by a particularly wealthy merchant in the age of myth.
JAPANESE: バラ色のベリル。 それは神話の時代に特に裕福な商人によって普及されたことにちなんで命名されました。

ENGLISH: A form of silica infused with the magic of the oceans, which makes this a favourite of sailors and fishermen.
JAPANESE: この船員や漁師のお気に入りになり、海洋の魔法を注入シリカの形態。

ENGLISH: A very rare gemstone which is often identified as an off-colour sapphire. The crystals are naturally hexagonal in shape and a favourite of tacticians.
JAPANESE: 非常に希少な宝石で、しばしばオフカラーのサファイアとして識別されます。 結晶は自然に六角形で、戦術家の好評です。

ENGLISH: Found in varying shades of red to pink. It is not as hard as most gemstones making it a poor choice for rings and other high-impact jewellery.
JAPANESE: 赤からピンクのさまざまな色合いで見つかりました。 ほとんどの宝石ほど難しいことではなく、リングやその他のインパクトのあるジュエリーには貧弱な選択肢です。

ENGLISH: The purest form of quartz. Rock crystals often feature in magical artifacts as they are a condensed form of the element of ice.
JAPANESE: 最も純粋な形の石英。 岩の結晶は、氷の要素の凝縮した形であるため、しばしば魔法のアーティファクトで特徴付けられます。

ENGLISH: One of the seven heavenly stones, rubies are the element of fire condensed into a solid form.
JAPANESE: 7つの天石の1つ、ルビーは固体の形に凝縮された火災の要素です。

ENGLISH: Often believed to protect the wearer from the attention of daemons, sapphires are much sought-after by mages for use in sky and air-based magic.
JAPANESE: 多くの場合、サファイアは、魔術師が空や空気ベースの魔法で使用するために多くの求められているデーモンからの注意から着用者を守ると考えられています。

ENGLISH: Often confused with heavenly stones like true rubies and sapphires, spinels are a lesser form of magic-infused gem which can be associated with any of the elements, depending on colour.
JAPANESE: 多くの場合、真のルビーやサファイアのような天の石と混同され、スピネルは色によって要素のいずれかに関連付けることができる魔法注入された宝石の小さな形です。

ENGLISH: A rare gemstone that can alternate between blue and violet. It is thought to be formed from the material body of a dead god.
JAPANESE: 青と紫が交互に変化する希少な宝石。 死神の物体から形成されると考えられている。

ENGLISH: Sometimes confused with the more common {{GEM.CITRINE.NOUN}} gem, topaz can be found in several colours but most commonly a yellowish brown. It was first discovered on an island which no longer exists.
JAPANESE: 時々より一般的な {{GEM.CITRINE.NOUN}} の宝石と混同され、トパーズはいくつかの色がありますが、最も一般的に黄色がかった茶色です。 これは、もはや存在しない島で最初に発見されました。

ENGLISH: Often found alongside {{ORE.CASSITERITE.ADJECTIVE}} ore. It is sometimes associated with earth magic.
JAPANESE: 多くの場合、{{オレ.カシテリト. 調整可能}} 鉱石と一緒に発見されます。 それは時々地球の魔法に関連付けられています。

ENGLISH: A blue-green mineral often used in decorations. It is thought to bring good luck to the bearer. It is often infused with the element of earth.
JAPANESE: 装飾によく使用される青緑色の鉱物。 運び手には幸運をもたらすと考えられています。 それはしばしば地球の要素を注入されます。

Welcome to the world of King under the Mountain! This is an early alpha version of the game with many more features and gameplay elements still to be implemented. Your intrepid band of dwarven settlers have chosen this location to found a new colony of their kingdom. Provide food, shelter and prosperity for them and who knows, maybe one day this will be the capital of a kingdom of its own!

ENGLISH: As well as occuring naturally as {{ORE.NATIVE_COPPER.NOUN}}, it is also easy to smelt from {{ORE.MALACHITE.NOUN}} ore. Copper has many uses, particularly in coinage, though it is not hard enough to create effective weapons.

ENGLISH: The king of metals. Although it is not the rarest or most valuable, gold is the most coveted metal by most races – particularly dwarves.
JAPANESE: 金属の王だ それは最も希少でも最も価値のあるものではありませんが、金はほとんどの人種（特にドワーフ）で最も切望された金属です。

ENGLISH: It is a poor military which does not have access to iron. Dwarven metalsmiths know the secrets of working this into {{METAL.STEEL.NOUN}}.
JAPANESE: それは鉄へのアクセスを持っていない貧しい軍です。 ドワーフの金属細工師は、これを {{METAL.STEEL.NOUN}} に組み込む秘訣を知っています。

ENGLISH: A silver-white metal that is highly resistant to corrosion. Platinum is rarer and therefore more valuable than {{METAL.GOLD.NOUN}}.
JAPANESE: 耐腐食性に優れた銀白色の金属です。 プラチナは {{メタル.GOLD.NOUN}} よりも稀で、貴重です。

ENGLISH: Like {{METAL.GOLD.NOUN}}, silver is often used for coinage and as solid bars for the trading of wealth.
JAPANESE: {{METAL.GOLD.NOUN}} と同様に、銀は金貨や富の取引のための堅い棒としてよく使われます。

ENGLISH: Far stronger than {{METAL.IRON.NOUN}} which makes for superior weapons and tools, only the dwarves know the secret of creating steel.
JAPANESE: 優れた武器や道具を実現する {{METAL.IRON.NOUN}} よりはるかに強く、ドワーフだけが鋼を作る秘訣を知っています。

ENGLISH: Your settlers have three basic needs to fulfil: food, drink and somewhere to sleep. Although they will complain about it for now, they can drink from the nearby river and sleep on the ground. What they can’t do is magic up some food from nowhere (at least, not without a mage around!) so we will focus on food to begin with.

The first thing you should do each spring is ensure that enough crops have been planted for the harvest in autumn. Farming is a reliable and sustainable food source, but you need to make sure you have enough crops to feed your population between each annual harvest.

A good rule of thumb to follow is to ensure you have 10 tiles of crops being sown for each settler in your population. Currently there are 7 settlers milling around, so go ahead and click “{{GUI.ZONES_LABEL}}” > “{{ROOMS.FARM}}”, and designate / drag out several farm plots on a grassy area.

With nothing else to do, your settlers will start preparing these {{ROOMS.FARM.PLURAL}} by tilling the earth to be ready for seeds to be sown. This doesn’t require any special tools or knowledge so everyone should get involved.

This prepares the plot to be sown, but you need to select which crop to grow on each farm plot before a farmer will come and plant the relevant seeds. Your settlers have brought with them a selection of different seeds. You can click “Resources” in the upper-right to get a breakdown of all the items in your settlement.

For the seeds to actually be available to your farmers, they need to be in a stockpile compared to being held in a dwarf’s inventory like they are currently. Click {{GUI.ZONES_LABEL}} > {{ROOMS.STOCKPILES}} > {{STOCKPILE.GROUP.SEEDS}} (you can right-click to go back up to a previous menu) and designate an area to be used for seeds to be stored.

Your settlers have also brought a bunch of tools with them what will need moving around. From {{ROOMS.STOCKPILES}} also choose {{STOCKPILE.GROUP.TOOLS}} and designate another area to be used to store tools.
After some time your settlers should put items they are not using into stockpiles, like the seeds that are to be sown.

Left-click on each of the {{ROOMS.FARM.PLURAL}} and select a crop to be planted there. Don’t select {{VEGETABLE.BARLEY}} or {{VEGETABLE.HOPS}} for now, as these crops are used in the production of beer, not food.

Your {{PROFESSION.FARMER.PLURAL}} will now get to work sowing the seeds you have selected to these {{ROOMS.FARM.PLURAL}}. Sowing seeds does not require any special tools but you might want to assign more settlers as {{PROFESSION.FARMER.PLURAL}}. Left-click on a settler who is wandering around aimlessly.

Clicking on a settler lets you see their name, professions, inventory, needs and happiness. Click on the blank square button next to their other professions to set a 3rd and final profession as a {{PROFESSION.FARMER.NOUN}}.

Note that some jobs require the settler to have a specific tool in their inventory, and if none are available in the settlement they won’t work on the jobs that require it. For example, you can assign more settlers as a {{PROFESSION.WOODCUTTER}}, but they can’t chop down trees without an available {{TOOL.AXE.NOUN}}.

Your crops will now grow and eventually be harvested by your {{PROFESSION.FARMER.PLURAL}} in the {{SEASON.AUTUMN}}. Some crops can be planted again later in the year and survive through the {{SEASON.WINTER}}, but some do not. To get the most out of your crops, it is best to produce soup from the vegetables harvested, or bread from grain.

Let’s get a {{ROOMS.KITCHEN}} set up to produce soup once your crops are ready. Go to the top level menu then {{GUI.ZONES_LABEL}} > {{ROOMS.KITCHEN}} and drag out a {{ROOMS.KITCHEN}} area. At this point in the development of King under the Mountain it does not matter if it is outside or indoors, but in the future you’ll want all your rooms to have a ceiling to protect them from the elements.

Unlike farm plots, kitchens (and most other rooms) need furniture to function. Click “Furniture” when you have placed a kitchen zone and you’ll be presented with the furniture that can be added. To produce soup, you need to build a {{FURNITURE.WATER_BARREL}}, {{FURNITURE.KITCHEN_WORKTOP}} and {{FURNITURE.CAULDRON}} in the same kitchen zone. Also, designate a {{STOCKPILE.GROUP.FOOD}} {{ROOMS.STOCKPILE}} to store any harvested crops.

When your crops have been harvested, cooks will bring vegetables to the {{FURNITURE.KITCHEN_WORKTOP}} before adding them to the {{FURNITURE.CAULDRON}} with water and producing soup! Making soup and baking bread means your food supplies will go much further - a single vegetable will feed a dwarf for a single meal, but 3 vegetables cooked into soup will provide 12 meals!

Eventually this kitchen will produce a cauldron full of steaming hot soup, but the cooks don’t like other dwarves getting in the way in their kitchen, so instead you need to have the soup brought to a feasting hall for the whole settlement to enjoy. Designate a feasting hall by clicking on {{GUI.ZONES_LABEL}} > {{ROOMS.FEASTING_HALL}}, then add a {{FURNITURE.CAULDRON}} to it. Note that a feasting hall cauldron won’t be placed until a cauldron containing thick, delicious soup is available.

Over time you will want to expand your food production but this will keep our small settlement nourished for the upcoming winter - your settlers have brought rations to sustain them while the first crops grow.

Most items and furniture are produced out of {{MATERIAL_TYPE.WOOD.ADJECTIVE}} {{RESOURCE.PLANKS.PLURAL}} or {{MATERIAL_TYPE.STONE.ADJECTIVE}} {{RESOURCE.STONE.BLOCK.PLURAL}}. It’s important to maintain a large supply of these. {{MATERIAL_TYPE.WOOD.ADJECTIVE}} {{RESOURCE.PLANKS.PLURAL}} are produced in a {{ROOMS.SAWMILL}}, and {{MATERIAL_TYPE.STONE.ADJECTIVE}} {{RESOURCE.STONE.BLOCK.PLURAL}} are crafted by a {{PROFESSION.STONEMASON}} in a {{ROOMS.MASONRY_WORKSHOP}}. Place one of each of these zones, and build a {{FURNITURE.WOODCUTTERS_BENCH}} and {{FURNITURE.STONEMASON_WORKBENCH}} in them.

Now you are ready to produce {{MATERIAL_TYPE.WOOD.ADJECTIVE}} {{RESOURCE.PLANKS.PLURAL}} and {{MATERIAL_TYPE.STONE.ADJECTIVE}} {{RESOURCE.STONE.BLOCK.PLURAL}}, but they require other resources to craft them - {{MATERIAL_TYPE.WOOD.ADJECTIVE}} {{RESOURCE.LOGS.PLURAL}} and {{RESOURCE.STONE.UNREFINED.PLURAL}}. Fortunately these can usually be harvested from the game world quite easily.

Select {{GUI.ORDERS_LABEL}} > {{GUI.ORDERS.CHOP_WOOD}} and click-and-drag over trees to let your woodcutters know to cut them down. Similarly you can select select {{GUI.ORDERS_LABEL}} > {{GUI.ORDERS.MINE}} and click-and-drag an area of the mountain to designate to be mined. Select enough of both to build your stockpiles back up to 40 of each.
Be careful with mining! A mined-out area of 7 by 7 tiles without a {{FURNITURE.PILLAR}} built within that area will collapse!
You can use the W, A, S and D keys or the arrow keys to pan the camera around. Moving the cursor to the edge of the screen also pans the camera, but this can be disabled in the options menu.
Scrolling the mouse wheel or pressing the Q and E keys zooms the camera in or out.
In the lower-right section of the screen is the minimap, and you can click on this to jump the camera to that point. Click on the “Minimap” label to show or hide the minimap.
Try out these camera controls and then click “Next” to proceed.

This covers the basics of playing King under the Mountain. For your next challenge, aim to set up a functioning {{ROOMS.METALWORKS}} with a {{FURNITURE.FORGE}} provided with fuel and refined metal ore. Refined metal ores are produced at the {{FURNITURE.ORE_CRUSHING_STATION}}, and fuel can be crushed from coal or produced out of {{MATERIAL_TYPE.WOOD.ADJECTIVE}} {{RESOURCE.LOGS.PLURAL}} with a {{FURNITURE.CHARCOAL_CLAMP}} in an {{ROOMS.EARTHWORKS}}. Good luck!

JAPANESE: 白い斑点を持つピンク赤色のキャップを持つキノコ。 戦闘に備えて戦士が用いる幻覚性性がある。

ENGLISH: A hardy root vegetable that survives the {{SEASON.WINTER}} frost. Carrots grow quickly but only produce a small crop. Can be planted in {{SEASON.SPRING}}, {{SEASON.SUMMER}} or {{SEASON.AUTUMN}}.
JAPANESE: {{シーズン.冬}} の霜を存続する丈夫な根菜です。 ニンジンは急速に成長しますが、小さな作物しか生成しません。 {{シーズン春夏}}、{シーズン夏}、{シーズン秋夏}} に植えられる。

ENGLISH: A cereal grain also known as maize. It produces a bountiful crop but takes around 2 seasons to grow and can not survive {{SEASON.WINTER}}, so it requires planting in early {{SEASON.SPRING}}.
JAPANESE: トウモロコシとしても知られている穀物。 それは豊かな作物を生み出すが、成長するのに約2シーズンかかり、{{SEASON.WINTER}} は生き残ることができないので、早く {{SEASON.SPRING} に植える必要があります。

ENGLISH: A very poisonous mushroom with a wide, flat cap. Eating even a tiny amount will almost certainly cause poisoning which can lead to death.
JAPANESE: 広くて平らなキャップを持つ非常に有毒なキノコ。 わずかな量でさえ食べることは、ほぼ確実に中毒を引き起こし、死につながる可能性があります。
エルフスベーンキノコ

ENGLISH: This mushroom has a simple, flavourless taste to most humanoids. Strangely, it tastes absolutely disgusting to elves, who often react with explosive vomiting upon consumption, or in extreme cases, a heart attack.
JAPANESE: このキノコは、ほとんどのヒューマノイドにシンプルで風味のない味を持っています。 不思議なことに、それはしばしば消費時に爆発的な嘔吐、または極端な場合には心臓発作に反応するエルフには絶対に嫌です。
フィストマッシュルーム

ENGLISH: A black-blue mushroom with a metallic taste. It is named for a group of bards from the age of darkness.
JAPANESE: メタリックな味の黒青のキノコ。 それは、闇の時代からバードのグループにちなんで命名されています。
グローマッシュルーム
グローマッシュルーム

ENGLISH: A magic-infused mushroom that gives off light and changes colour with the seasons.
JAPANESE: 光を放り出し、季節によって色が変わる魔法のマッシュルーム。

ENGLISH: A flower used for the flavouring of beer. Must be planted in {{SEASON.SPRING}}.
JAPANESE: ビールの風味に使われる花。 {{シーズンスプリング}} に植える必要があります。

ENGLISH: Once thought to exist only in the Hudds region, it is now found throughout the world.
JAPANESE: かつてはハッズ地域にのみ存在すると考えられ、今では世界中で発見されています。

ENGLISH: A starchy root vegetable which can survive {{SEASON.WINTER}} making it a good choice for most settlements. Can be planted in {{SEASON.SPRING}}, {{SEASON.SUMMER}} or {{SEASON.AUTUMN}}.
JAPANESE: {{SEASON.WINTER}} 生き残ることができるデンプン質の根菜で、ほとんどの集落に適しています。 {{シーズン春夏}}、{シーズン夏}、{シーズン秋夏}} に植えられる。

ENGLISH: Fat Hat, Plump Turban, Puffy Helmet; This fabled mushroom goes by many names. Legend holds that long ago, many communities of dwarves subsisted entirely on a domesticated strain of this fungus.
JAPANESE: 太った帽子、ふっくらターバン、ふわふわヘルメット。この伝説のキノコは、多くの名前で行きます。 伝説は、ずっと前に、ドワーフの多くのコミュニティは、この真菌の飼いならされた株に完全に住んだことを保持しています。

ENGLISH: A white and black spotted mushroom. It has been known to affect the appearance of those who ingest it.
JAPANESE: 白と黒の斑点きのこ。 それを摂取する人々の外観に影響を与えることが知られている。
サングローマッシュルーム
サングローマッシュルーム

ENGLISH: A bright yellow mushroom which glows with the appearance of sunlight. It loses this glow the moment it is harvested.
JAPANESE: 太陽の光で輝く明るい黄色のキノコ。 収穫された瞬間にこの輝きを失います。
シロップパウダーマッシュルーム
シロップパウダーキノコ

ENGLISH: A round orange/yellow mushroom with a white underside. It is said to have been used by mages long ago, but for what purpose, nobody knows.
JAPANESE: 白い下面を持つ丸いオレンジ/黄色のキノコ。 昔、魔道者によって使われてきたと言われていますが、どんな目的のためにも、誰も知りません。

ENGLISH: A plant which grows large red berries often used as a vegetable. Can only be planted in {{SEASON.SPRING}}.
JAPANESE: 野菜としてよく使われる大きな赤い果実を育てる植物。 {{シーズンスプリング}} にのみ植えることができる。

ENGLISH: A cereal grain generally used for the production of bread. It can survive {{SEASON.WINTER}} but takes a while to grow, so it is either planted in {{SEASON.SPRING}} or {{SEASON.AUTUMN}}.
JAPANESE: 穀物の穀物は、一般的にパンの生産に使用されます。 {{シーズン.冬}} は生き残ることができますが、成長にはしばらく時間がかかるので、{{シーズン.スプリング}} または {{シーズン.AUTUMN} に植えられます。

ENGLISH: Also known as iron sulfate, this salt has several uses, including as a soil additive to improve crop farming. (Usages of vitriol are not yet implemented in King under the Mountain)
JAPANESE: 硫酸鉄としても知られるこの塩は、作物農業を改善するための土壌添加剤として含め、いくつかの用途を有する。 （硝酸塩の使用は、まだ山の下の王に実装されていません）
